#summary A few projects and people who use libarchive.

= Who Uses Libarchive? =

 * FreeBSD
  * libarchive was originally developed for [http://freebsd.org/ FreeBSD]
  * bsdtar is the default system tar on FreeBSD
  * bsdcpio will be the default system cpio on FreeBSD

 * Package Managers
  * [http://www.archlinux.org/pacman/ Pacman] package manager on [http://www.archlinux.org/ Arch Linux] uses libarchive
  * [http://www.netbsd.org/ NetBSD]'s pkg_install package manager uses libarchive.

 * Archiving tools
  * The [http://www.tarsnap.com/ tarsnap] service uses libarchive in its client software.
  * Kai Wang has built a drop-in "ar" on libarchive

 * File browsers
  * [http://projects.gnome.org/nautilus/ Nautilus] file browser uses libarchive
  * The [http://www.cybernoia.de/software/archivemount/ archivemount] filesystem (part of [http://fuse.sourceforge.net/ FUSE]) uses libarchive

 * Ports of libarchive, bsdtar, etc.
  * [http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/ GnuWin32] and [http://cygwin.org/ Cygwin] for Windows.
  * [http://libarchive.darwinports.com/ Darwinports] for MacOS
  * [http://packages.debian.org/sid/libarchive-dev Debian Linux]
  * [http://packages.gentoo.org/package/app-arch/libarchive Gentoo]
